title: Low water pressure at farthest tap (Phase 1)
problem: Water pressure at farthest fixtures was below requirement during testing. Complaints expected post-handover. Problem noted after a weather event.
solution: Verified pump curve, PRVs, valve positions, and pipe sizing. Root cause: partially closed isolation valve and undersized branch. Corrective: open/label valves, adjust PRV, resize branch if needed. Prevent: valve tagging and hydraulic review. Recorded actions in the NCR log and obtained consultant sign-off.

title: Rebar cover nonconformance (Level 3)
problem: Cover meter inspection showed insufficient cover in localized areas before casting. Durability and corrosion risk flagged by QA. Inspection was requested by QA prior to handover.
solution: Stopped pour. Adjusted bars using approved spacers/chairs, re-tied reinforcement, re-checked cover readings. Verified formwork line/level. Prevent: spacer density checklist and mandatory pre-pour QA sign-off. Added an extra hold point to prevent recurrence.

title: Cable tray overfill
problem: Additional cables installed and tray fill appears above recommended capacity. Overheating risk. Discovered during closing inspection.
solution: Checked tray fill and derating. Corrective: add parallel tray or reroute, verify separation and ampacity. Prevent: change request process and updated cable schedule. Updated the method statement and briefed the crew.

title: Low concrete strength test result
problem: 28-day cube results came back below specified strength for one pour. Risk of structural non-compliance and rework. Problem noted after a weather event.
solution: Checked sampling and cube curing. Verified mix design and batch tickets. Took in-situ cores and did rebound hammer mapping. If cores meet design, accept with engineer approval; if not, plan strengthening (jacketing/FRP) or partial demolition. Prevent: controlled cube curing box, tighter batching checks, and hold points. Captured before/after photos and updated as-built notes.

title: Rebar cover nonconformance (Phase 1)
problem: Cover meter inspection showed insufficient cover in localized areas before casting. Durability and corrosion risk flagged by QA. Inspection was requested by QA prior to handover.
solution: Stopped pour. Adjusted bars using approved spacers/chairs, re-tied reinforcement, re-checked cover readings. Verified formwork line/level. Prevent: spacer density checklist and mandatory pre-pour QA sign-off. Verified the fix through re-test and documented results.

title: Variation due to design change
problem: Revised drawings changed scope and quantities. Contractor needs a clear variation submission. Discovered during closing inspection.
solution: Logged instruction, compared revisions, quantified deltas, priced per contract rates, and prepared time impact. Submitted formal variation with supporting BOQ and programme impacts. Prevent: strict change-control register. Recorded actions in the NCR log and obtained consultant sign-off.

title: Wet area tile debonding (Area B)
problem: Tiles sounded hollow and some debonded in a bathroom. Concern about substrate prep and waterproofing. Discovered during closing inspection.
solution: Removed affected tiles, checked screed moisture and waterproofing. Root cause: poor surface key and insufficient adhesive coverage. Re-screed if needed, re-waterproof with curing time, use correct adhesive and coverage checks. Prevent: substrate hold point and adhesive batch approval. Recorded actions in the NCR log and obtained consultant sign-off.

title: Cable tray overfill (Level 3)
problem: Additional cables installed and tray fill appears above recommended capacity. Overheating risk. Problem noted after a weather event.
solution: Checked tray fill and derating. Corrective: add parallel tray or reroute, verify separation and ampacity. Prevent: change request process and updated cable schedule. Recorded actions in the NCR log and obtained consultant sign-off.

title: Wet area tile debonding
problem: Tiles sounded hollow and some debonded in a bathroom. Concern about substrate prep and waterproofing. Discovered during closing inspection.
solution: Removed affected tiles, checked screed moisture and waterproofing. Root cause: poor surface key and insufficient adhesive coverage. Re-screed if needed, re-waterproof with curing time, use correct adhesive and coverage checks. Prevent: substrate hold point and adhesive batch approval. Updated the method statement and briefed the crew.

title: Frequent MCB tripping (Basement)
problem: A DB circuit tripped repeatedly under normal load. Risk of overheating or faulty wiring. Client raised a concern during site walk.
solution: Isolated loads, measured current, tested insulation resistance, verified breaker rating. Root cause: loose neutral causing heating and nuisance trips. Corrective: re-terminate to proper torque, replace damaged breaker, re-test. Prevent: torque marking and thermal imaging spot checks. Verified the fix through re-test and documented results.

title: Honeycombing after formwork removal (Level 3)
problem: Voids and honeycombing observed on a column face after stripping. Possible lack of compaction and segregation. Issue appeared during routine testing.
solution: Assessed depth. If shallow: remove loose material, apply bonding agent, repair with approved mortar/micro-concrete and cure. If deep: engineer review (epoxy injection or recast). Prevent: trained vibrator operators, revised pour sequence, and suitable aggregate for congested zones. Verified the fix through re-test and documented results.

title: Hot work without permit (Phase 1)
problem: Hot work observed without valid permit-to-work. Fire and compliance risk. Inspection was requested by QA prior to handover.
solution: Stopped activity, issued permit, ensured fire watch and extinguishers, briefed crew. Prevent: daily PTW audits and supervisor accountability. Verified the fix through re-test and documented results.

title: Cable tray overfill (Area B)

solution: Checked tray fill and derating. Corrective: add parallel tray or reroute, verify separation and ampacity. Prevent: change request process and updated cable schedule. Added an extra hold point to prevent recurrence.

title: Hot work without permit (Level 3)
problem: Hot work observed without valid permit-to-work. Fire and compliance risk. Problem noted after a weather event.
solution: Stopped activity, issued permit, ensured fire watch and extinguishers, briefed crew. Prevent: daily PTW audits and supervisor accountability. Added an extra hold point to prevent recurrence.

title: Pump breakdown mid-pour (Level 3)
problem: Concrete pump failed mid-pour, risking cold joints and quality issues. Problem noted after a weather event.
solution: Switched to backup pump, controlled pour interface, treated construction joint as required, ensured compaction and curing. Root cause: poor preventive maintenance. Prevent: standby plan and pre-pour equipment checks. Added an extra hold point to prevent recurrence.

title: Frequent MCB tripping (Phase 1)
problem: A DB circuit tripped repeatedly under normal load. Risk of overheating or faulty wiring. Client raised a concern during site walk.
solution: Isolated loads, measured current, tested insulation resistance, verified breaker rating. Root cause: loose neutral causing heating and nuisance trips. Corrective: re-terminate to proper torque, replace damaged breaker, re-test. Prevent: torque marking and thermal imaging spot checks. Updated the method statement and briefed the crew.

title: Rebar cover nonconformance (Level 3)
problem: Cover meter inspection showed insufficient cover in localized areas before casting. Durability and corrosion risk flagged by QA. Issue appeared during routine testing.
solution: Stopped pour. Adjusted bars using approved spacers/chairs, re-tied reinforcement, re-checked cover readings. Verified formwork line/level. Prevent: spacer density checklist and mandatory pre-pour QA sign-off. Verified the fix through re-test and documented results.

title: Paint blistering (Tower A)
problem: Blistering and peeling paint appeared after finishing. Client rejected during snagging. Problem noted after a weather event.
solution: Checked substrate moisture and curing time. Root cause: painting over damp plaster and wrong primer. Corrective: scrape, dry, apply sealer/primer, repaint. Prevent: moisture threshold checks before painting. Added an extra hold point to prevent recurrence.

title: Drain pipe slope issue
problem: Drainage line slope is less than required, causing slow drainage and blockage risk. Inspection was requested by QA prior to handover.
solution: Surveyed invert levels, corrected hangers and re-laid section to achieve slope, performed flow test. Prevent: laser level verification and pre-close inspection. Verified the fix through re-test and documented results.

title: Variation due to design change (Phase 1)
problem: Revised drawings changed scope and quantities. Contractor needs a clear variation submission. Issue appeared during routine testing.
solution: Logged instruction, compared revisions, quantified deltas, priced per contract rates, and prepared time impact. Submitted formal variation with supporting BOQ and programme impacts. Prevent: strict change-control register. Updated the method statement and briefed the crew.

title: Paint blistering (Basement)
problem: Blistering and peeling paint appeared after finishing. Client rejected during snagging. Inspection was requested by QA prior to handover.
solution: Checked substrate moisture and curing time. Root cause: painting over damp plaster and wrong primer. Corrective: scrape, dry, apply sealer/primer, repaint. Prevent: moisture threshold checks before painting. Recorded actions in the NCR log and obtained consultant sign-off.

title: Duct insulation damaged (Level 3)
problem: Duct insulation torn and loose during ceiling closure inspection. Issue appeared during routine testing.
solution: Repaired/replaced insulation, sealed joints, added protection in traffic zones. Root cause: damage by other trades. Prevent: coordination and protection before closing ceilings. Added an extra hold point to prevent recurrence.

title: Late material approval delay (Tower A)
problem: Critical material submittal approval delayed, impacting programme and handover. Discovered during closing inspection.
solution: Escalated through tracker, proposed equivalent alternates, and resequenced works. Prevent: earlier procurement plan and weekly approval reviews with defined turnaround. Captured before/after photos and updated as-built notes.

title: Cable tray overfill (Basement)
problem: Additional cables installed and tray fill appears above recommended capacity. Overheating risk. Inspection was requested by QA prior to handover.
solution: Checked tray fill and derating. Corrective: add parallel tray or reroute, verify separation and ampacity. Prevent: change request process and updated cable schedule. Recorded actions in the NCR log and obtained consultant sign-off.

title: HVAC low airflow complaint (Basement)
problem: Occupants reported weak airflow. Commissioning readings showed low CFM on multiple branches. Inspection was requested by QA prior to handover.
solution: Checked damper positions, duct leakage, filters, fan VFD settings, and balancing report. Root cause: dampers mis-set and filters clogged from early operation. Corrective: clean/replace filters, set VFD, seal leaks, re-balance. Prevent: staged commissioning and protection during finishing works. Recorded actions in the NCR log and obtained consultant sign-off.

title: Late material approval delay (Tower A)
problem: Critical material submittal approval delayed, impacting programme and handover. Discovered during closing inspection.
solution: Escalated through tracker, proposed equivalent alternates, and resequenced works. Prevent: earlier procurement plan and weekly approval reviews with defined turnaround. Captured before/after photos and updated as-built notes.

title: Frequent MCB tripping (Area B)
problem: A DB circuit tripped repeatedly under normal load. Risk of overheating or faulty wiring. Problem noted after a weather event.
solution: Isolated loads, measured current, tested insulation resistance, verified breaker rating. Root cause: loose neutral causing heating and nuisance trips. Corrective: re-terminate to proper torque, replace damaged breaker, re-test. Prevent: torque marking and thermal imaging spot checks. Added an extra hold point to prevent recurrence.

title: Early-age slab cracking (Basement)
problem: Hairline cracks appeared on a newly cast slab within 24–48 hours. Ambient temperature was high and curing was inconsistent. Concern about durability and client acceptance. Issue appeared during routine testing.
solution: Verified crack pattern and depth (visual + crack gauge). Checked mix tickets and site water addition. Root cause: plastic shrinkage from rapid evaporation and delayed curing. Immediate: start continuous curing (wet hessian + curing compound), shade area, restrict traffic. Prevent: schedule pours in cooler hours, windbreaks, strict slump control and no re-tempering. Updated the method statement and briefed the crew.

title: Drain pipe slope issue
problem: Drainage line slope is less than required, causing slow drainage and blockage risk. Problem noted after a weather event.
solution: Surveyed invert levels, corrected hangers and re-laid section to achieve slope, performed flow test. Prevent: laser level verification and pre-close inspection. Recorded actions in the NCR log and obtained consultant sign-off.

title: Basement wall leakage (Tower A)
problem: Seepage noted through a basement wall joint after rain. Risk of dampness and client complaint. Client raised a concern during site walk.
solution: Mapped leakage path and joint detail. Root cause: membrane discontinuity at construction joint. Corrective: expose joint, PU injection, reinstate membrane with correct overlap/termination, add waterstop where applicable. Prevent: joint detailing checklist and photo records before backfill. Updated the method statement and briefed the crew.

title: Scaffold guardrail missing (Basement)
problem: HSE inspection found missing guardrails/toe boards on scaffold platform. Fall risk immediate. Problem noted after a weather event.
solution: Stopped work, installed guardrails/toeboards, re-inspected and re-tagged scaffold. Root cause: scaffold altered after inspection. Prevent: daily checks and controls against unauthorized changes. Recorded actions in the NCR log and obtained consultant sign-off.

title: Weld defects in NDT report (Basement)
problem: UT report indicated lack of fusion and porosity in welds. Structural integrity and acceptance criteria impacted. Problem noted after a weather event.
solution: Marked defects and executed repair per WPS: grind out, clean, control preheat, re-weld by qualified welder, re-test UT. Prevent: WPS briefing, in-process inspection, and parameter control. Verified the fix through re-test and documented results.

title: HVAC low airflow complaint (Phase 1)
problem: Occupants reported weak airflow. Commissioning readings showed low CFM on multiple branches. Problem noted after a weather event.
solution: Checked damper positions, duct leakage, filters, fan VFD settings, and balancing report. Root cause: dampers mis-set and filters clogged from early operation. Corrective: clean/replace filters, set VFD, seal leaks, re-balance. Prevent: staged commissioning and protection during finishing works. Verified the fix through re-test and documented results.

title: Backfill settlement in trench (Level 3)
problem: Surface settlement and ponding occurred over a recently backfilled trench. Risk to paving and services. Discovered during closing inspection.
solution: Reviewed compaction records and moisture content. Root cause: inadequate compaction lifts and high moisture. Corrective: re-excavate, compact in 200–300 mm lifts to specified density, retest. Prevent: moisture control and independent density testing. Added an extra hold point to prevent recurrence.

title: Steel connection bolt mismatch (Area B)
problem: Bolt holes did not align for a steel beam connection during erection. Erection delayed and misfit suspected. Discovered during closing inspection.
solution: Held erection. Verified drawing revision and as-built dimensions. Corrected by reaming within tolerance and using approved bolt grade/washer plates; otherwise fabricate replacement splice plate. Prevent: fit-up check before dispatch and strict revision control. Verified the fix through re-test and documented results.

title: Weep holes blocked (Area B)
problem: Retaining wall drainage weep holes were clogged by debris, increasing hydrostatic pressure risk. Inspection was requested by QA prior to handover.
solution: Cleared weep holes, inspected filter media/geotextile and drainage layer continuity. Prevent: protection during backfill and inspection before final cover. Captured before/after photos and updated as-built notes.
